Key Match Events: Coby White made a go-ahead layup with 47 seconds left, and the Chicago Bulls topped Victor Wembanyama and the San Antonio Spurs 114-110 on Monday night.
Chicago used an 11-0 run to trim San Antonio's lead to 79-71 with 5:24 left in the third quarter.
San Antonio led 110-103 with 3:53 left, but Vucevic and LaVine each made a 3 to get Chicago within one with 2:38 to go.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wembanyama had 23 points, 14 rebounds and eight blocks for San Antonio, which carried a 95-82 lead into the final period.
Chicago used 5 for 8 from 3 in the fourth quarter, compared to 1 for 9 for San Antonio.
Others: The game was played at the United Center with a crowd of 18,886.
This was the opener of a four-game trip for San Antonio.
